de.mrapp.android.util.view

Class ViewHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
      • de.mrapp.android.util.view.ViewHolder

  • public class ViewHolder
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
    A view holder, which maintains references to previously references views in order to avoid findViewById-method calls when reusing these views.
    Since:
    1.14.0

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder

        itemView

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ViewHolder(android.view.View parentView)
      Creates a new view holder.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void clear()
      Removes all references, which are stored by the view holder.

      Returns the view, which belongs to a specific resource ID.

      • Methods inherited from class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder

    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewHolder

        public ViewHolder(@NonNull
                  android.view.View parentView)
        Creates a new view holder.
        Parameters:
        parentView - The view, the view holder is associated with, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • getParentView

        @NonNull
public final android.view.View getParentView()
        Returns the view, the view holder is associated with.
        Returns:
        The view, the view holder is associated with, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • findViewById

        public final android.view.View findViewById(@IdRes
                                            int viewId)
        Returns the view, which belongs to a specific resource ID. If the view has already been referenced, the view, which is stored by the view holder, will be returned. Otherwise the method findViewById(int):View of the parent view, the view holder belongs to, is used to reference the view.
        Parameters:
        viewId - The resource ID of the view, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The ID must be a valid resource ID of a view, which belongs to the given parent view
        Returns:
        The view, which belongs to the given resource ID, as an instance of the class View or null, if no view with the given ID is available

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Removes all references, which are stored by the view holder.
